alert.note: Alert for Bolivar Peninsula; Brazoria Islands; Galveston Island; Matagorda Islands (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Rip Current Statement issued October 03 at 8:46AM CDT until October 03 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK IN EFFECT THROUGH THIS EVENING... ...COASTAL FLOOD STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...For the High Rip Current Risk, dangerous rip currents. For the Coastal Flood Statement, isolated minor coastal flooding. * WHERE...Gulf-facing beaches, including the Matagorda Peninsula, Brazoria County beaches, Galveston Island and the Bolivar Peninsula. * WHEN...For the High Rip Current Risk, through this evening. For the Coastal Flood Statement, through Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...Some water on low lying roads and property. Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water.
info.instruction: Do not drive through flooded roadways. Swim near a lifeguard and away from rocks, jetties, and piers. If caught in a rip current, relax and float. Don`t swim against the current. If able, swim in a direction following the shoreline. If unable to escape, face the shore and call or wave for help.
